message.content:
Niacin, also known as vitamin B3 or nicotinic acid, is an essential nutrient that helps convert food into energy for the body. It plays a crucial role in maintaining proper cell function and the overall health of various organs such as skin, nerves, and digestion.

- Niacin supports brain function: Vitamin B3 aids in healthy nerve transmission by helping with the synthesis of neurotransmitters. This promotes better cognitive communication among your neurons.
- Increases HDL cholesterol (good cholesterol) levels: High-density lipoprotein (HDL) protects from cardiovascular disease; niacin can help increase these levels while lowering LDL cholesterol.
- Supports energy production: Niacin is vital for converting carbohydrates, fats and proteins we consume into usable forms to create ATP molecules which provide energy within all living cells.
- Antioxidant properties: As a precursor to Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (NAD), niacin acts indirectly as an antioxidant neutralizing harmful free radicals within your system leading to increased immunity against inflammation & chronic diseases.
- Improves skin health: By enhancing blood flow beneath skin along with improving cellular rejuvenation process; hence it's used therapeutically in many dermatological disorders like acne vulgaris etc

Sone natural sources of niacin include,

- Meat products such as lean beef cuts & chicken breast
 - Fishes rich in omega 3 fatty acids like salmon & tuna varieties
 - Whole grain cereals including wheat bran flakes or oatmeal porridge recipes'
 - Nuts especially almonds walnuts peanut butter '
-Natural dairy choices low-fat milk yogurt cheese ','
